name: bottleneck
summary: Identify network chokepoints and critical links
description:
The bottleneck command identifies critical points in the road network where disruption would have the greatest impact on connectivity. It finds:

- Bridge edges (edges whose removal disconnects the graph)
- Articulation points (nodes whose removal disconnects the graph)
- High-betweenness edges (frequently used in shortest paths)

Useful for infrastructure planning and resilience analysis.

options.-n, --top: Number of top bottlenecks to return (default: 20)

output:
List of network bottlenecks with:
- Type (bridge edge, articulation point, high betweenness)
- Location coordinates
- Connected road names
- Impact score
- Components affected if removed
